What topics of conversation would Ulam and Von Neumann typically share?

answers.text: gossiping and giggling, swapping Jewish jokes, and drifting in and out of mathematical talk

qas.question: What would Ulam use to cheer up Von Neumann in the hospital?

context: Von Neumann's closest friend in the United States was mathematician <a0_0>Stanislaw Ulam<a0_0/>. A later friend of Ulam's, Gian-Carlo Rota writes: "They would spend hours on end <a1_0>gossiping and giggling, swapping Jewish jokes, and drifting in and out of mathematical talk<a1_0/>." When von Neumann was dying in hospital, every time Ulam would visit he would come prepared with <a2_0>a new collection of jokes<a2_0/> to cheer up his friend. He believed that much of his mathematical thought occurred intuitively, and he would often go to sleep with a problem unsolved, and know the answer immediately upon waking up.
